body.name: Seagate 2TB Pipeline HD SATA 6Gb/s 64MB Cache 3.5-Inch Internal Bare Drive (ST2000VM003)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 20 hrs 48 mins
features: 2 TB storage capacity with an 64 MB cache features SATA 6Gb/s NCQ interface
The drive cable should not be more than 50 centimeter than that might be an issue. Check if the connector connected tight to the drive
Optomized for high-definition consumer and DVR applications
Easy-to-manage multi-room video delivery of upto 16 simultaneous HD streams
24x7 operational profile to meet the always -on-demands of the DVR market
body.description: Supporting capacities up to 2TB, Seagate Pipeline HD series hard drives were designed to deliver 24x7, reliable operation with performance tuning oriented toward low-power consumption, silent operation and smooth video streaming performance. In fact, the Pipeline HD was designed to meet Energy Star and other strict consumer power consumption standards. With the ability to support of up to 16 simultaneous streams of HD content in multiple rooms and operate at temperatures of up to 75°C, they provide reliable storage with a 24x7 operational profile that enables consumers to take full advantage of premium services like digital video recording and video on demand. Boasting the industry's lowest overall power consumption profiles and coupled with the Seagate commitment to environmental compliance, Pipeline HD drives are more than green; they offer customers a comprehensive sustainability value proposition which incorporates leading environmental stewardship and a focus on customer satisfaction. NOTE: (a) Noisy Drive - Abnormal noises include: 1. High-pitched whining sound can be an indication of abnormal function. 2. Noises can be caused by mounting issues. This is due to either a high-frequency vibration in the mounting hardware or a potential drive failure. 3. Repeated, regular tapping, grinding or beeping. 4. Seagate hard drives do not contain audio speakers. Some failure mechanisms may make a regular repeating beep from the computer's internal speaker. This may or not be hard drive related. Check your system documentation for an explanation of system beep codes. If a drive failure is possible, it is always important to make an immediate backup. 5. Two hard clicks at start up and then a boot error message or system shutdown is a symptom of a failed drive. Check your cables and connections in case they might have gotten loose. (b) If you have received a SMART error, we strongly recommend that you stop everything and make an immediate backup of any and all important data contained on this drive that is not already backed up.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.7 3.7 out of 5 stars 807 ratings 3.7 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It just failed out of nothing in less than 6 months.
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this on Jun 7, 2023, arrived quick. It worked fine, it was fast was well. I got ALL my photos and music on my new drive... Yesteryda Nov 6, it just died. Its completely gone.The computer now detects it as '4GB'.I did swap the cables, with know good, the issue changed to the new port.Their own test fails, cannot even re-format it from CMD. Also tried on linux...Now im stuck with this one with no warranty, their website takes to the 'place where you purchased it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Received 3 bad drives in a row
reviews.reviewText: I bought 2 of these initially, 1 is still working, 1 failed within a few days. I have since received 2 bad replacements, one had a head crash on first boot, the other keeps continually unmounting after about an hour, and now isn't even visible to bios. Avoid these drives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars HD Works - New but no warranty from Seagate (if you buy, check review for buyer)
reviews.reviewText: About the drive: Seagate 2TB (from US_Electronics) It works (as it should) - have only been using 1 week. Put it in my desktop RAID array and it rebuilt without a problem. As one reviewer pointed out, it seems that Seagate themselves may not officially honor any warranty. Checking the warranty status via their website returns the message to contact the place of purchase for warranty support (see picture). More importantly, there were no problems with the SMART data (indicates heath of the drive) and it indicates 0 hours of use and powered on/off only 3 times (a reasonable number for testing purposes, plus when 1 for when I powered it on myself). I don't believe the power on count or hours can be easily changed/forged so I'll believe the data. (see picture)About Other Reviews: When reading reviews to consider if I should buy this or not, I noticed some mentioned other sellers (and I thought one even mentioned another brand). I purchased from US_Electronics so can't speak to others. Also, given that this is in a redundant RAID array, if the drive did fail after the Amazon warranty period and the seller didn't do anything, I wouldn't have lost my data - just the money I paid (so I was willing to risk it, so so far no problems).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The drives were fine..
reviews.reviewText: The drives were fine... somehow... despite how they were not individually protected and allowed to bounce off of each other in the box. (4 were purchased at once)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quiet and spacious...
reviews.reviewText: I bought this 2TB drive to replace a failed drive in my music server against the manufacturer's recommendation -- no user serviceable parts inside, etc. No problems. I'm very happy with my purchase. My wife was so impressed with all the money we saved over having to buy a new music server that she insisted I take her out to dinner.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Crapped out literally 2 days after amazon couldn't take them back!!
reviews.reviewText: I bought 2 of these and one crapped out 1 day after I couldn't return to Amazon, and the other went the next day. I will never buy another Seagate product ever again. The drive seemed slow, but I figured it was just because it wasn't a SSD which is what I was used to. 2 months without a hitch using them to back up my disks. So, what would have happened if these drives crapped out and so did my main disk? I'd have been up a river!!Seagate makes horrible hard drives and I cannot stress enough how unhappy I am with them. Two drives bought... Two drives dead!! I bought Toshiba, Western Digital, and even some white label hard drives that have had longer life then these two abominations!! I am done with Seagate. These are just the next in a long string of bad hard drives that I have bought from this company. I was willing to give them another try, but this is beyond inexcusable!! It is like they have rigged these things to last just long enough to work until the Amazon warranty runs out.I build computers and I build a lot of them! I will never again put a Seagate hard drive in to anyone's rig! I will warn them against it and I will tell them this story before steering them towards other more reputable companies! Too many people here have had the same problems and I do not see any end in sight. Seagate, you have lost thousands of dollars from me and my business!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars installed easily (all HDDs do)
reviews.reviewText: I see there are a lot of reviews on here stating that the drive was DOA, or that it crashed soon after receiving it. I wanted to leave a positive review because I did not have that experience. It arrived working, installed easily (all HDDs do), and is trucking right along. I almost completely filled my drive the day I got it, use it every day, and it's nothing if not reliable. I'll update if anything changes but otherwise I give this drive 5 stars, because that's what I'm getting out of it right now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Bad hard drives (?) or bad seller
reviews.reviewText: I've used Seagate drives in the past. Never really had a problem with them. Then, after putting together a home server and buying a couple of these, one died to the point that the data was gone and couldn't be re-partitioned. The other one I was able to recover the data. At first, I thought it was the motherboard. I sent it in an they told me there was a repair necessary. Fortunately, it was under warranty. They send it back, I get some more new drives, and, in no less than a month, I am having read/speed problems with two others. I connected them up to some USB adapter to read them through the USB ports thinking that it's just the SATA on the motherboard. One drive, even though it was, at least, readable on the motherboard, is giving off nothing but errors through the USB adapter. The other one has the speed of a dial-up connection. I know one of them was connected to a PCI SATA card. So, I now doubt the motherboard was the reason why they're failing on me. The person I bought it from was ISellAll. The thing is I don't know how aware they are with their merchandise. I don't remember how the other drives arrived. But, one hard drive arrived positioned in a corner of the shipping box with cushioning on only one side. They then proceeded to ship me two more drives of which I hadn't bought, shipped the same way.
Muy buen producto y llego a tiempo

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Used for extra file storage.Installed easily and started first time.Recognised by OS , click next, next, finish and your all up and running.Only running for couple of daysso far, but it's a main brand and not expecting any issues, only had a couple of HDD failures an the last 30 years.It was a couple of £ more expensive when purchased compared to when I first spotted this deal, but it's still half the price for a new HDD so definitely a winner for me.

Die 2 TB musste ich ungewollt kaufen, da meine 500gb die auch sehr gut war und nie abgestürzt ist leider kaputt gegangen ist während mein PC an war was nicht gut ist. Zum Glück war es nur die 500gb die kaputt war, jetzt wo ich die 2TB eingebaut habe läuft der PC wieder reibungslos wie neu unglaublich. Der Preis war gut und die Lieferung war schnell.

C'était un disque dur de stockage, sur lequelle je stockais des jeux mais le disque a lâché, à peine 3 mois après achat. Ni le vendeur, ni Amazon, ni le fabricant le reprennent en garantie.Très déçu de cet achat
